intro: Sesbania aculeata, commonly known as the hairy sesbania, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a leguminous species belonging to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant has a bushy growth habit and is often found in disturbed soils, making it an invasive species in some areas. Its seeds are encased in pods and can remain viable in the soil for several years. Sesbania aculeata is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
